caption: For Paris, this place is basically just a spire in an open area.  It was the location of a famous prison, but it was destroyed, so it's essentially just an large open area, and the spire.  It's a little cool and it is near to a lot of other things so if you have the time, I would say why not.
An ideal place to sit and relax watching people go about their business.  You can also take in the skateboard people do their thing.
Beautiful we go to see the Olympic torch and some ballerinas dancing
The place where the infamous Bastille prison uses to be. Now with the July Column commemorating the 1830 July Revolution and engraved with the names of those who died in it.
Historic, mythical, and located in a diverse,  lively and festive area.
Historical place to visit in Paris.  Around there was a Bastille in XVIII century. Now, it's only the colonne remains that

Recently spent a week in Paris and enjoyed seeing the July Column (Colonne de Juillet) at Place de la Bastille again. This is a 47 metre tall column monument that was erected in the centre of the plaza between 1835-40.  Previously the location of the infamous Bastille Prison which was destroyed during the early days of the French Revolution. What you find here is a bronze column, topped by a gilded figure - the Genius of Liberty'. The base of the column includes decorative bas-reliefs which are not easy to see from afar.  Unfortunately, the monument is surrounded by a busy roundabout, making it less convenient to view up close. However, you can have a good look from the street intersections that lead to the square.  In the end, an impressive monument but not easy to view from up close. Have a look-see when passing through Place de la Bastille in the La Marais.

Visited just days prior to Bastille Day when much activity was ongoing.  The whole Bastille area on the edge of la Marais is worth exploring.  The column is at the hub and round a bout for the street leading up to the Bastille.  Ornate column with gold figure atop is worth the quick look.

This is beautiful.. Again a history structure in the Centre of Paris.. Near Bastille Palace The structure very tall and its very closer to Paris Opera house... You can notice this structure from far... situated on a bridge on River Sienna...
It's a monument in the Bastille area and a landmark. You can't go up it, so don't even try.

A monument thick in history standing on the site of the Bastille. "To the glory of the French people who armed themselves and fought for the defense of public liberties for 3 memorable days the 27, 28, 29 juillet 1830". History sometimes repeats itself. In this photo armoured vehicles await the angry French mob demonstrating for the 4 Saturday in a row, December 2018.
Just bumped into a market (not knowing if it was temporary) with lots of fruits, meat, seafood and other commodities for sale. A surprise at the good taste of fruits and green figs.

It's a cool statue in a roundabout.  I am not familiar with the significance or importance of this monument but it was a nice reference point for our group as it was close to our hotel and had many dining and bar options near it.

This of course dominates this significant square, Bastille Square in Paris. Eventhough the column was boarded up at the base, it still towers over this Square. As a "yardstick" to represent the former Bastille prison, this is an impressive obelisk of historical significance. Absolutely  worth visiting. It's been photographed so often as it really represents the history of this city.

As of late 2018, there is an heavy construction site all around so don't expect to take amazing pictures.  The column itself is nothing to write home about, but since the Bastille doesn't exist anymore you might as well enjoy that.

The column itself is impressive and is trading mark of the historic bastille square. Road construction wont allow access to it however the whole area is bubbly, vibrant and connects several areas togther.

The steel and bronze made July Column located at the centre of Place de la Bastille. The July Column has an internal spiral staircase but in order to preserve the structure it is not open to visitors.
